qas.question: What nation lost the Battle of Yarmouk?
Who was the Byzantine leader at the Battle of Yarmouk?
Along with Syria, where did the Muslims extend their control after the Battle of Yarmouk?
Who was the father of Yazid ibn Abi Sufyan?
Along with Muawiyah, Abu Sufyan ibn Harb and Yazid ibn Abi Sufyan, what notable Muslim participated in the Battle of Yarmouk?

plausible_answers.text: the Islamic Conquest of Syria Fatuhusham by al-Imam al-Waqidi

qas.question: What is an example of a late history book?
What were Muawiyah's father and brothers appointed as before they converted to Islam?
Who appointed Muhammad as a commander?
Who never fought at the battle of Yarmouk?
What battle did the Byzantines win?

context: However many early history books like <b5_0>the Islamic Conquest of Syria Fatuhusham by al-Imam al-Waqidi<b5_0/> state that after the conversion to Islam Muawiyah's father <a3_0><b7_0>Abu Sufyan ibn Harb<b7_0/><a3_0/> and his brothers Yazid ibn Abi Sufyan were appointed as <b6_0>commanders in the Muslim armies<b6_0/> by Muhammad. Muawiyah, Abu Sufyan ibn Harb, <b8_0>Yazid ibn Abi Sufyan<b8_0/> and <a4_0>Hind bint Utbah<a4_0/> fought in the Battle of Yarmouk. The defeat of the <a0_0>Byzantine<a0_0/> Emperor <a1_0>Heraclius<a1_0/> at the <b9_0>Battle of Yarmouk<b9_0/> opened the way for the Muslim expansion into <a2_0>Jerusalem<a2_0/> and Syria.
